text:
A chopper carrying Union Minister of State for Home Kiren Rijiju and a BJP MP on Tuesday made an emergency landing at the Hindon airbase near here following engine trouble after being airborne for nearly 20 minutes.

“We are all safe,” Mr. Rijiju told PTI on the phone. The Minister, along with LS member from Tehri-Garhwal Mala Rajya Laxmi Shah, had taken off for Tehri on an Mi-17V5 helicopter from capital’s Safdarjung airport.

Eight people on board

There were eight people on board the helicopter, including Home Ministry officials and two television journalists.

The pilot detected a problem in the engine after around 20 minutes following which he landed the chopper at Hindon under emergency condition.

“The pilot then decided to make an emergency landing in the nearby Hindon airbase,” Mr. Rijiju said.

Travelling to Tehri

The Minister said he was travelling to Tehri to review disaster preparedness and to meet paramilitary forces deployed along the Sino-India border. — PTI
title: Rijiju’s chopper makes emergency landing
